poem:
Title: "In the Dawn of Service"

Red plum slash of a budget,
customer satisfaction on the sours –
is this the world?

Yet, a glint. Firms emerge,
scattering tiny light sparks,
in the marketplace of despair.

Like small chickens,
appearing at daybreak,
among the fallen apples of deceit.

Ay, the faint echo of integrity,
a gospel in a land of wanted desire,
still some companies put customers
first.
